questions.question: What is the primary focus of the Medium Access Control (MAC) Sublayer?
options: Determining the best route for packets through a subnet
Managing access to a shared communication medium among multiple users
Providing end-to-end reliable data delivery
Translating logical addresses into physical signal patterns
questions.answer: Managing access to a shared communication medium among multiple users

questions.question: What is the primary challenge addressed by the Channel Allocation Problem?
options: How to encrypt data on a point-to-point link
How to efficiently allocate a single shared channel among competing users
How to determine the physical location of a wireless host
How to synchronize the clocks of all nodes in a network
questions.answer: How to efficiently allocate a single shared channel among competing users

questions.question: Which of the following describes the disadvantage of using static channel allocation for bursty traffic?
options: It leads to excessive packet collisions
A user's assigned bandwidth may go unused while others are blocked
It requires a complex central controller
It increases the overhead of the frame header
questions.answer: A user's assigned bandwidth may go unused while others are blocked

questions.question: What is the defining characteristic of the Pure ALOHA protocol?
options: Users sense the carrier before transmitting
Users transmit frames whenever they have data to send
Users must wait for a specific time slot to transmit
A central controller assigns transmission rights
questions.answer: Users transmit frames whenever they have data to send

questions.question: In Pure ALOHA, why must a station wait a random amount of time before retransmitting after a collision?
options: To allow the receiver time to clear its buffer
To avoid repeated collisions with the same station
To give priority to lower-numbered stations
To synchronize with the start of the next time slot
questions.answer: To avoid repeated collisions with the same station

questions.question: How does Slotted ALOHA improve upon the performance of Pure ALOHA?
options: By implementing carrier sensing
By dividing time into discrete intervals and requiring transmissions to start at slot boundaries
By reducing the frame size to minimize collision probability
By using different frequencies for different stations
questions.answer: By dividing time into discrete intervals and requiring transmissions to start at slot boundaries

questions.question: What is the fundamental difference between CSMA and the ALOHA protocols?
options: CSMA uses sequence numbers for every frame
CSMA stations sense the channel (listen) before attempting to transmit
CSMA eliminates the need for acknowledgments
CSMA is only applicable to wired networks
questions.answer: CSMA stations sense the channel (listen) before attempting to transmit

questions.question: In 1-persistent CSMA, what does a station do if it finds the channel is currently busy?
options: Wait a random time and then sense the channel again
Continually sense the channel until it becomes idle, then transmit immediately
Transmit anyway with probability 'p'
Abort the transmission and notify the network layer
questions.answer: Continually sense the channel until it becomes idle, then transmit immediately

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of CSMA with Collision Detection (CSMA/CD) over basic CSMA?
options: It increases the transmission speed of the medium
Stations can abort transmission immediately upon detecting a collision, saving time and bandwidth
It allows multiple stations to transmit simultaneously without interference
It removes the requirement for a random backoff time
questions.answer: Stations can abort transmission immediately upon detecting a collision, saving time and bandwidth

questions.question: Which popular networking technology is historically based on the CSMA/CD protocol?
options: Bluetooth
Token Ring
Ethernet
Wi-Fi
questions.answer: Ethernet

questions.question: In a bit-map protocol, what is the purpose of the contention slots that precede data transmission?
options: To synchronize the bits of the upcoming frame
To allow stations to announce their intent to send data in a specific order
To detect and resolve hardware-level collisions
To exchange encryption keys for the session
questions.answer: To allow stations to announce their intent to send data in a specific order

questions.question: What is the role of a 'Token' in a Token Ring network?
options: It acts as a destination address for a frame
It represents the exclusive right to transmit on the medium
It is a special bit used for error correction
It is used to poll the base station for status updates
questions.answer: It represents the exclusive right to transmit on the medium

questions.question: In a wireless network, what is the role of a 'Base Station' (e.g., an Access Point)?
options: To provide power to mobile hosts
To relay packets between the wired infrastructure and wireless hosts
To encrypt all traffic at the application layer
To manage the physical movement of mobile devices
questions.answer: To relay packets between the wired infrastructure and wireless hosts

questions.question: What is 'Multipath Propagation' in the context of wireless networking?
options: The ability to send data over multiple different frequencies
Signals reflecting off obstacles and reaching the receiver at slightly different times
A node moving between multiple different base stations
Using multiple antennas to increase data rates
questions.answer: Signals reflecting off obstacles and reaching the receiver at slightly different times

questions.question: Which problem occurs in wireless networks when a station cannot sense another station that is currently transmitting to the same receiver?
options: Exposed Terminal Problem
Hidden Terminal Problem
Multipath Fading
Capture Effect
questions.answer: Hidden Terminal Problem

questions.question: In the IEEE 802.11 (Wi-Fi) standard, which coordination function is contention-based and mandatory for all stations?
options: Point Coordination Function (PCF)
Distributed Coordination Function (DCF)
Logical Link Control (LLC)
Binary Exponential Backoff
questions.answer: Distributed Coordination Function (DCF)

questions.question: How do the RTS (Request to Send) and CTS (Clear to Send) frames help solve the hidden terminal problem?
options: They increase the signal strength of the transmitter
They reserve the channel by notifying all stations within range of both the sender and receiver
They eliminate the need for acknowledgments (ACKs)
They encrypt the data so collisions do not matter
questions.answer: They reserve the channel by notifying all stations within range of both the sender and receiver

questions.question: What does the Network Allocation Vector (NAV) represent in 802.11?
options: A physical list of all active nodes
A virtual carrier-sensing mechanism indicating how long the channel will be busy
The routing table for the wireless subnet
The unique MAC address of the Access Point
questions.answer: A virtual carrier-sensing mechanism indicating how long the channel will be busy

questions.question: Why is fragmentation used in 802.11 wireless networks?
options: To allow packets to fit into smaller switch buffers
To reduce the probability of a transmission error ruining an entire large packet
To enable multicast delivery to diverse devices
To bypass the need for RTS/CTS handshaking
questions.answer: To reduce the probability of a transmission error ruining an entire large packet

questions.question: Which Interframe Space (IFS) provides the highest priority for access to the medium in 802.11?
options: SIFS (Short IFS)
PIFS (PCF IFS)
DIFS (DCF IFS)
EIFS (Extended IFS)
questions.answer: SIFS (Short IFS)
